Member Function Documentation

bool AnalysisStreamExpression::doAnalysis ( ProbeSetGroup &  psGroup,
IntensityMart &  iMart,
bool  doReport,
bool  alleleSummaryOnly = false 
) [virtual]

Do the analysis for a particular group of probe sets.

If we see a genotype probeset and user wishes it try to break it up into expression probesets. The code for dividing up a genotyping probeset should probably live in ChipLayout eventually, but for now the initial implementation is here.

Parameters:
psGroup - Collection of probe sets to get probes from.
iMart - Object containing raw data values for all chips.
doReport - Should the quantification report object be called?
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

If we see a genotype probeset and user wishes it try to break it up into expression probesets. The code for dividing up a genotyping probeset should probably live in ChipLayout eventually, but for now the initial implementation is here.

Parameters:
psGroup - Collection of probe sets to get probes from.
layout - How probes/probesets are laid out on chip.
iMart - Object containing raw data values for all chips.
doReport - Should the quantification report object be called?
alleleSummaryOnly - this is a parameter that makes sense in the base class AnalysisStream::doAnalysis, but not here. Included here only to make the inheritance work. Feel free to ignore.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

Todo:
handle Marker type probesets

void AnalysisStreamExpression::fillInProbeSetFromBlocks ( ProbeSetGroup &  psNewGroup,
ProbeSetGroup &  psGroup,
const std::vector< short > &  blocks 
)

Fill in psNewGroup with probes from psGroup based on the block indexes in the blocks vector.

To divide a genotyping probeset based on Allele (A or B) you would use the 1,3 blocks for A and 2,4 blocks for B. If you just want one strand of a particular allele then it would be 1 for A+, 2 for B+, 3 for A- and 4 for B-. This is sensitive to the vagaries of the genotyping probeset structure which is poorly documented and ever "innovating"... Eventually this should be moved to the ChipLayout class or ProbeSet class.

Parameters:
psNewGroup 
psGroup 
blocks

SelfCreate * AnalysisStreamExpression::newObject ( std::map< std::string, std::string > &  param  )  [static]

This static function should be overridden by child classes to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly with the parameters in the string, string map.

All objects created this way should be deleted when finished using.
